meanings.definition: The practice of exchanging things with others for mutual benefit.
meanings.sent1: In our friendship, we always follow the principle of reciprocity.
meanings.sent2: Reciprocity is important in maintaining healthy relationships.
meanings.sent3: At the potluck, there was a funny reciprocity of everyone bringing the same dessert.
meanings.sent4: The reciprocity of kindness between neighbors was like a warm blanket on a cold night.
meanings.sent5: The concept of reciprocity can make our community stronger.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being reciprocal.
meanings.sent1: The reciprocity of their friendship was evident in their actions.
meanings.sent2: There was a sense of reciprocity in their interactions.
meanings.sent3: The reciprocity of their agreement made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: The reciprocity of trust between them was unbreakable.
meanings.sent5: The reciprocity of their bond was unspoken but deeply felt.

meanings.sent1: The reciprocity of sharing resources benefits both parties.
meanings.sent2: Reciprocity allows for a fair give-and-take arrangement.
meanings.sent3: The reciprocity of trading snacks at lunch was amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: The reciprocity of respect between colleagues creates a harmonious work environment.
meanings.sent5: Reciprocity in granting permissions ensures a balanced relationship.
